results.title: Architecture west
results.brief_description: Shows examples of architecture in the Western American states beginning with the square log block house that served as General Sheridan’s headquarters at Yam Hill, Oregon. The Monterey style house built for the American consul to Mexican California, a Victorian mansion, the First Church of Christ Scientist at Berkeley, the steel-aluminium -glass Equitable Building in Portland, Oregon, the Prudential building in Los Angeles, and modern homes designed by John Yoen, depicting important influences and style.

results.title: Architecture of Japan
results.brief_description: Shows how the traditional architectural design elements based on wooden construction are adopted to the steel and concrete in contemporary building in Japan. Examples of historical, traditional and modern architecture which are distinctively Japanese are surveyed.
results.description: Shows how the traditional architectural design elements based on wooden construction are adopted to the steel and concrete in contemporary building in Japan. Examples of historical, traditional and modern architecture which are distinctively Japanese are surveyed.

results.title: Architecture: a performing art
results.creator_credit: Film Australia and Michael Robertson Film Productions
results.brief_description: An overview of the career and lifestyle of the Australian architect, John Andrews whose better known accomplishments include the CTT Tower in Toronto - the tallest free-standing structure in the world, the International Shipping Terminal at Miami, the Cameron Offices in Canberra and the American Express Tower in Sydney.

results.title: Architecture
results.creator_credit: Career Productions, Citizen's Assurance and Mutual Life and Citizens' Assurance Co.
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
The architect is trained to understand the needs of people and how labour, machines and materials can create buildings which meet these needs. Although he may arrange for the help of special experts such as structural or lighting engineers he too must have a grasp of these technical matters.

results.title: Architects of England
results.brief_description: A study of the work of English architects from the eleventh century until the present day, with reference to the kind of material and designs used and adapted for English needs, and the work of Inigo Jones and Christopher Wren.
results.description: A study of the work of English architects from the eleventh century until the present day, with reference to the kind of material and designs used and adapted for English needs, and the work of Inigo Jones and Christopher Wren.

results.title: Architect Athfield
results.creator_credit: Sam Neill, Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Examines the practical philosophy, the achievements and frustrations of one of New Zealand’s most lively and innovative architects, Ian Athfield. In 1975 Athfield won an international competition directed towards providing housing for 140,000 squatters from the Tondo area in Manila.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Neill, Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: Arachnida
results.brief_description: Part one deals with the study of the external features of spiders, and their habits including different methods of web-building and catching food. Types of spiders include: garden spider, water spider, and raft spider. Coition and the spinning of cocoons to protect eggs is also shown. The second part of the film supplements the above material, showing biological relatives of these spiders, including the primitive sea scorpions, found only as fossils, the aquatic king crab, land crabs, carnivorous harvestmen, and the ararina, including the cheesemite, red spiders, sheep tick, and the so-called sea spiders. Commentary by Carleton Hobbs, photography by Charles D. Head and F. Percy Smith. No other credits available. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Arabian children
results.creator_credit: Donald G. Hoffman and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The life of a family living on a farm in Saahab in TransJordan. Describes the events of a typical day and shows the children minding sheep, working in the fields and in the house, going to school and visiting a nearby village. It also emphasises the importance of water and the camel to their way of life.

results.title: Arab traders of the Persian Gulf
results.creator_credit: Peggie Broadhead and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “People of Many Lands”.
A journey across the barren desert areas of the Gulf of Arabia with Arab traders. These are nomadic people living in primitive conditions. The film is one of a series which deals with a wide range of people, some of whom have retained primitive ways of life and have little contact with the outside world.

results.title: The Arab refugees
results.creator_credit: Martin Bunnel, Ben Park and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: 1.3 million Arab refugees now live in camps on both sides of the Jordan, in Gaza, and in neighbouring Arab lands. Since 1949 the U.N. relief agency has been working to provide emergency food and shelter, education and long term job training. But the presence of these proud, angry and uprooted people must continue to be an obstacle to peace - they are humans being denied fundamental rights.
